March Madness guide: Parking, tasty food, fun attractions, and more
The madness is coming to the 'Burgh. Pittsburgh is hosting March Madness action this week.
PPG Paints Arena will have first and second-round games on March 21 and March 23. You can also purchase your tickets now for all of the opening weekend's action.
Ticket packages are available here, including Session 1 (two games on March 21), Session 2 (two games on March 21) and Session 3 (two games on March 23).
Here's who will play in Pittsburgh.
FIRST ROUND - Thursday, March 21
- Midwest Regional: 3 Creighton vs. 14 Akron (1:30 p.m.)
- Midwest Regional: 6 South Carolina vs. 11 Oregon (4 p.m.)
- South Regional: 3 Kentucky vs. 14 Oakland (7:10 p.m.)
- South Regional: 6 Texas Tech vs. 11 North Carolina State (9:40 p.m.)
SECOND ROUND - Saturday, March 23
- Creighton/Akron winner vs. South Carolina/Oregon winner
- Kentucky/Oakland winner vs. Texas Tech/North Carolina State winner

Pittsburgh's Action News 4 has put together a guide to help all local and visiting basketball fans navigate the city.
Attractions
Located in the city's Oakland neighborhood, the green oasis featured 15 acres of a world-class garden experience.
Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh
A family of four museums throughout the city, each with its own theme.
Located in the Strip District, The Heinz History Center has been voted as the best history museum in the country. The USA Today Readers poll recognized the museum as a premier destination venue. The history center includes six floors of exhibits and artifacts and also houses the Western Pennsylvania Sports Museum, highlighting the area's iconic sports moments.
Fallingwater is an iconic home built over a western Pennsylvania waterfall by Frank Lloyd Wright. Located 75 minutes from downtown Pittsburgh in Mill Run, Fayette County, Fallingwater is among the most famous of Wright's creations.

PPG Paints Arena information
Parking
Parking is available in the PPG Paints Arena Lots as well as the Jim Shorkey Auto Group Parking Garage at PPG Paints Arena for non-hockey events. Event parking rates vary. For more information on event parking, please call 412-804-3371.
For security purposes, only wallets/wristlets (4"x6"x1"), and medical/diaper bags will be permitted inside PPG Paints Arena and all items are subject to searches upon entrance.
Large bags, coolers, backpacks and sealed packages (including gifts for performers and or athletes) of any kind are not permitted.
ADA accessibility
ADA-accessible tickets can be bought online here, in person at the CHI Health Center Omaha box office, or by calling 402-341-1500.
Wheelchair escorts are available upon request and are on a first-come, first-served basis. They can be available at any of the entrances and will meet guests and take them to their seat.
ADA parking is available also on a first-come, first-served basis. There are designated stalls in each of the parking lots and the garage. Guests can also be dropped off or picked up along 10th Street on the west side of the convention center.
For more information on ADA accessibility, click the link here.
Reminders
PPG Paints Arena is a cash-free facility. All major credit and debit cards are accepted as well as Apple and Google Pay. There are multiple reverse ATMs that will put cash onto a card inside of the facility.
PPG Paints Arena is a mobile-only facility. For event entry, a mobile ticket must be displayed on a smartphone. All mobile tickets will feature a rotating barcode. As a result, camera screenshots or paper printouts will not work. If you place your digital ticket in your Apple wallet, no barcode will be visible - however, the scanners will detect it! If you do not have a mobile ticket for entry, you will be directed to the DICK'S Sporting Goods Box Office inside the Highmark Gate for assistance.
